availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James D. Young (Princeton, Caldwell County, Kentucky, teacher and lieutenant)

body.p: Princeton, Caldwell County, Kentucky, teacher and lieutenant. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas E. Young and Melinda Young. School teacher in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 20th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) from January 6, 1862, to January 17, 1865. Promoted from private to 1st sergeant on February 28, 1862. Promoted to 2nd lieutenant on March 1, 1863. Mustered out on January 17, 1865, in Louisville.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 48, 957.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District No. 1, p. 103.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 35.
